To integrate the provided CSS styles and HTML structure for the "Add Event" page into your existing HTML template, you can combine the styling rules and layout structure. Here's how you can achieve that:

  1. Merge the CSS styles from the first snippet into the <style> tag in the second snippet.
  2. Combine the HTML structure of the "Add Event" form into the existing HTML template.

Heres the updated HTML template with the integrated styles and layout:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    {% load static %}
    {% load group_filters %}
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/home.css' %}">
    <title>Add Event</title>

    <!-- JavaScript function for confirmation -->
    <script>
        function confirmLogout() {
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to log out?")) {
                return true; // Continue with logout
            }
            return false; // Cancel logout
        }
    </script>

    <style>
        /* Add your CSS styles here */
        .container {
            margin: 0 auto; /* Center the container horizontally */
            padding: 20px;
            background-color: #f9f9f9;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
            text-align: center; /* Added this line for consistency */
        }

        .form-group {
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .form-group label {
            display: block;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        /* Set width for all input fields except submit button */
        .form-group input[type="text"],
        .form-group select,
        .form-group textarea,
        .form-group input[type="date"],
        .form-group input[type="time"],
        .form-group input[type="number"],
        .form-group input[type="submit"] { /* Include input[type="submit"] in the selector */
            width: calc(50% - 12px); /* Decrease the width here */
            padding: 8px; /* Decrease the padding to maintain proportion */
            border: 1px solid #ccc;
            border-radius: 5px;
            box-sizing: border-box; /* Ensure padding and border are included in the width */
        }

        .form-group input[type="submit"] {
            padding: 10px 20px; /* Keep the padding */
            background-color: #59ff00;
            color: #fff;
            border: none;
            border-radius: 5px;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: background-color 0.3s;
        }

        .form-group input[type="submit"]:hover {
            background-color: #00b309; /* Change color on hover */
        }

        /* Add margin between "From Date" input box and "From Time" text */
        #from_time_label,
        #time_to_label {
            margin-top: 10px;
        }

        /* General body styling with transparent background image */
        body {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            height: 100vh;
            background: linear-gradient(rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8), rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8)), url('images/ashi.png') no-repeat center center;
            background-size: cover;
            position: relative;
        }

        .header {
            text-align: center;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .header h1 {
            font-size: 24px;
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
        }

        .logout-container {
            position: absolute;
            top: 10px;
            right: 10px;
        }

        .logout-container form {
            display: inline-block;
        }

        .logout-container input[type="submit"] {
            padding: 10px 20px;
            font-size: 16px;
            background-color: #4CAF50;
            color: white;
            border: none;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: background-color 0.3s;
        }

        .logout-container input[type="submit"]:hover {
            background-color: #45a049;
        }

        .nav-container {
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .nav-container a {
            display: inline-block;
            padding: 10px 20px;
            font-size: 16px;
            color: black;
            text-decoration: none;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: color 0.3s;
            margin: 0 20px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .nav-container a:hover {
            color: #45a049;
        }

        .nav-container a .icon {
            display: block;
            margin: 0 auto 8px auto;
        }

        .nav-container a .caption {
            display: block;
            text-align: center;
        }

        @media (max-width: 600px) {
            .logout-container input[type="submit"], .nav-container a {
                padding: 8px 16px;
                font-size: 14px;
            }

            .nav-container a .icon {
                width: 32px;
                height: 32px;
                margin-bottom: 4px;
            }

            .nav-container a {
                margin: 0 10px;
            }
        }

        .create-user-button {
            background-color: #008CBA;
            color: white;
            border: none;
            padding: 10px 20px;
            text-align: center;
            text-decoration: none;
            display: inline-block;
            font-size: 16px;
            margin-right: 20px;
            transition: background-color 0.3s;
        }

        .create-user-button:hover {
            background-color: #004E6E;
        }
    </style>
</head>

                <input type="submit" value="Logout">

        </div>

        <div class="container">
            <div class="nav-container">
                <!-- Conditional navigation links based on user role -->
                {% if user.is_superuser %}

                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">

                        <span class="caption">Attendance</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/product.jpg' %}" alt="Product Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Product</span>
                    </a>
                {% elif user|has_group:"Supervisor" %}
                    <!-- Supervisor links -->
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/depemp1.jpg' %}" alt="Department Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Department And Employees</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:attendance_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/attendance.jpg' %}" alt="Attendance Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Attendance</span>
                    </a>
                {% elif user|has_group:"HR" %}
                    <!-- HR links -->
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/depemp1.jpg' %}" alt="Department Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Department And Employees</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/product.jpg' %}" alt="Product Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Product</span>
                    </a>
                {% endif %}
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="container">
            <h1>Add Event</h1>
            <hr>
            <form action="{% url 'add_event' %}" method="POST" enctype="multipart/form-data">
                {% csrf_token %}
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="title">Title</label>
                    {{ form.title }}
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="mode">Mode</label>
                    {{ form.mode }}
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="no_participants">Number of Participants</label>
                    {{ form.no_participants }}
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="description">Description</label>
                    {{ form.description }}
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="from_date">From Date</label>
                    <input type="date" id="from_date" name="from_date">
                    <label id="from_time_label" for="from_time">From Time</label>
                    <input type="time" id="from_time" name="from_time">
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="date_to">To Date</label>
                    <input type="date" id="date_to" name="date_to">
                    <label id="time_to_label" for="time_to">To Time</label>
                    <input type="time" id="time_to" name="time_to">
                </div>
                <input type="hidden" name="dept_club" value="{{ default_club_id }}">
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label>Dept Club:</label>
                    <input type="text" value="{{ default_club_name }}" readonly>
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="tag">Tag</label>
                    {{ form.tag }}<br>
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <label for="brochure">Brochure</label>
                    {{ form.brochure }}
                </div>
                <div class="form-group">
                    <input type="submit" value="Submit">
                </div>
            </form>
        </div>

    {% elif not user.is_authenticated %}
        <a href="{% url 'login' %}">Log in</a>
    {% endif %}
</body>
</html>

In this combined template:

  • The styles from your "Add Event" page are merged into the <style> tag.
  • The "Add Event" form is inserted into the main body of the template.
  • The overall layout structure is maintained with conditional rendering based on the user's authentication and role.

Got it! Heres how you can integrate the CSS styles for the "Add Event" page into the existing HTML template. I will only add the necessary CSS rules without altering the existing HTML structure.

Add the CSS rules in the <style> tag of your existing template:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    {% load static %}
    {% load group_filters %}
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/home.css' %}">
    <title>Document</title>

    <!-- JavaScript function for confirmation -->
    <script>
        function confirmLogout() {
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to log out?")) {
                return true; // Continue with logout
            }
            return false; // Cancel logout
        }
    </script>

    <style>
        /* Add your CSS styles here */
        .container {
            margin: 0 auto; /* Center the container horizontally */
            padding: 20px;
            background-color: #f9f9f9;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
            text-align: center; /* Added this line for consistency */
        }

        .form-group {
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .form-group label {
            display: block;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        /* Set width for all input fields except submit button */
        .form-group input[type="text"],
        .form-group select,
        .form-group textarea,
        .form-group input[type="date"],
        .form-group input[type="time"],
        .form-group input[type="number"],
        .form-group input[type="submit"] { /* Include input[type="submit"] in the selector */
            width: calc(50% - 12px); /* Decrease the width here */
give external css and html

Sure, here is how you can separate the CSS into an external stylesheet and then reference it in your HTML file.

First, create an external CSS file (e.g., styles.css) and add your CSS styles to it:

css
/* styles.css */
.container {
    margin: 0 auto; /* Center the container horizontally */
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    border-radius: 10px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    text-align: center; /* Added this line for consistency */
}

.form-group {
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.form-group label {
    display: block;
    font-weight: bold;
}

/* Set width for all input fields except submit button */
.form-group input[type="text"],
.form-group select,
.form-group textarea,
.form-group input[type="date"],
.form-group input[type="time"],
.form-group input[type="number"],
.form-group input[type="submit"] { /* Include input[type="submit"] in the selector */
    width: calc(50% - 12px); /* Decrease the width here */
    padding: 8px; /* Decrease the padding to maintain proportion */
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-sizing: border-box; /* Ensure padding and border are included in the width */
}

.form-group input[type="submit"] {
    padding: 10px 20px; /* Keep the padding */
    background-color: #59ff00;
    color: #fff;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: background-color 0.3s;
}

.form-group input[type="submit"]:hover {
    background-color: #00b309; /* Change color on hover */
}

/* Add margin between "From Date" input box and "From Time" text */
#from_time_label,
#time_to_label {
    margin-top: 10px;
}

/* General body styling with transparent background image */
body {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    height: 100vh;
    background: linear-gradient(rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8), rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8)), url('images/ashi.png') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    position: relative;
}

.header {
    text-align: center;
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.header h1 {
    font-size: 24px;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}

.logout-container {
    position: absolute;
    top: 10px;
    right: 10px;
}

.logout-container form {
    display: inline-block;
}

.logout-container input[type="submit"] {
    padding: 10px 20px;
    font-size: 16px;
    background-color: #4CAF50;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: background-color 0.3s;
}

.logout-container input[type="submit"]:hover {
    background-color: #45a049;
}

.nav-container {
    margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.nav-container a {
    display: inline-block;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    font-size: 16px;
    color: black;
    text-decoration: none;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: color 0.3s;
    margin: 0 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

.nav-container a:hover {
    color: #45a049;
}

.nav-container a .icon {
    display: block;
    margin: 0 auto 8px auto;
}

.nav-container a .caption {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
}

@media (max-width: 600px) {
    .logout-container input[type="submit"], .nav-container a {
        padding: 8px 16px;
        font-size: 14px;
    }

    .nav-container a .icon {
        width: 32px;
        height: 32px;
        margin-bottom: 4px;
    }

    .nav-container a {
        margin: 0 10px;
    }
}

.create-user-button {
    background-color: #008CBA;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    text-align: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    display: inline-block;
    font-size: 16px;
    margin-right: 20px;
    transition: background-color 0.3s;
}

.create-user-button:hover {
    background-color: #004E6E;
}

Next, update your HTML file to reference this external CSS file:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    {% load static %}
    {% load group_filters %}
<head>

    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/styles.css' %}"> <!-- Link to your external CSS file -->
    <title>Document</title>

    <!-- JavaScript function for confirmation -->
    <script>
        function confirmLogout() {
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to log out?")) {
                return true; // Continue with logout
            }
            return false; // Cancel logout
        }
    </script>
</head>
<body>
    {% if user.is_authenticated %}
        <div class="header">
            <div class="title">EmployeeHub</div>
            <div class="action-buttons">
                <!-- Create User Button (if user is superuser) -->
                {% if user.is_superuser %}
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:create_user' %}" class="create-user-button">Create User</a>
                {% endif %}
                
                <!-- Logout Form -->
                <form action="{% url 'logout' %}" method="post" onsubmit="return confirmLogout()" style="display: inline;">
                    {% csrf_token %}
                    <a href="#" onclick="this.closest('form').submit()">Logout</a>
                </form>
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="container">
            <div class="nav-container">
                <!-- Conditional navigation links based on user role -->
                {% if user.is_superuser %}
                    <!-- Superuser links -->
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/depemp1.jpg' %}" alt="Department Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Department And Employees</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:attendance_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/attendance.jpg' %}" alt="Attendance Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Attendance</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/product.jpg' %}" alt="Product Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Product</span>
                    </a>
                {% elif user|has_group:"Supervisor" %}
                    <!-- Supervisor links -->
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/depemp1.jpg' %}" alt="Department Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Department And Employees</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:attendance_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/attendance.jpg' %}" alt="Attendance Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Attendance</span>
                    </a>
                {% elif user|has_group:"HR" %}
                    <!-- HR links -->
                    <a href="{% url 'employee:depemp_home' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/depemp1.jpg' %}" alt="Department Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Department And Employees</span>
                    </a>
                    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">
                        <img class="icon" src="{% static 'images/product.jpg' %}" alt="Product Icon" width="96" height="96">
                        <span class="caption">Product</span>
                    </a>
                {% endif %}
            </div>
        </div>
    {% elif not user.is_authenticated %}
        <a href="{% url 'login' %}">Log in</a>
    {% endif %}
</body>
</html>

This setup should ensure that the "EmployeeHub" title is on the left, and the "Create User" and "Logout" buttons are styled like navigation links on the right side of the header. The CSS file includes responsive adjustments to ensure the layout looks good on smaller screens.

Sure, here's the updated CSS and HTML without using flexbox. The "EmployeeHub" title will be on the top left, and the "Create User" and "Logout" buttons will be on the top right.

External CSS File (styles.css)

css
/* General body styling with transparent background image */
body {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    height: 100vh;
    background: linear-gradient(rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8), rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8)), url('images/ashi.png') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
}

/* Header styling */
.header {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    position: relative;
}

.header .title {
    font-size: 24px;
    font-weight: bold;
    position: absolute;
    left: 20px;
    top: 50%;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
}

.action-buttons {
    position: absolute;
    right: 20px;
    top: 50%;
    transform: translateY(-50%);
}

    background-color: #4CAF50;

    border: none;

    cursor: pointer;
    text-decoration: none;
    margin-left: 10px;

}

    background-color: #45a049;

    margin: 0 20px;

        padding: 8px 16px;
        font-size: 14px;
    }

        margin: 0 10px;
    }
}

Certainly! Here's the initial HTML and CSS code you provided, with the styling applied within the <style> tags and the external CSS file respectively:

HTML File

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    {% load static %}
    {% load group_filters %}
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/home.css' %}">
    <title>Document</title>

    <!-- JavaScript function for confirmation -->
    <script>
        function confirmLogout() {
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to log out?")) {
                return true; // Continue with logout
            }
            return false; // Cancel logout
        }
    </script>

    <style>
        /* Add your CSS styles here */
        .container {
            margin: 0 auto; /* Center the container horizontally */
            padding: 20px;
            background-color: #f9f9f9;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        }

        .form-group {
            margin-bottom: 20px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .form-group label {
            display: block;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        /* Set width for all input fields except submit button */
        .form-group input[type="text"],
        .form-group select,
        .form-group textarea,
        .form-group input[type="date"],
        .form-group input[type="time"],
        .form-group input[type="number"],
        .form-group input[type="submit"] { /* Include input[type="submit"] in the selector */
            width: calc(50% - 12px); /* Decrease the width here */
            padding: 8px; /* Decrease the padding to maintain proportion */
            border: 1px solid #ccc;
            border-radius: 5px;
            box-sizing: border-box; /* Ensure padding and border are included in the width */
        }

        .form-group input[type="submit"] {
            padding: 10px 20px; /* Keep the padding */
            background-color: #59ff00;
            color: #fff;
            border: none;
            border-radius: 5px;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: background-color 0.3s;
        }

        .form-group input[type="submit"]:hover {
            background-color: #00b309; /* Change color on hover */
        }

        /* Add margin between "From Date" input box and "From Time" text */
        #from_time_label,
        #time_to_label {
            margin-top: 10px;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>

product_home.html

Explanation:

  • Flexbox Layout: The layout is managed using Flexbox to center align content vertically and horizontally (display: flex, justify-content: center, align-items: center).
  • Responsive Design: Media queries (@media) ensure that the navigation links adjust their appearance for smaller screens (max-width: 600px).

Replace # in the href attributes with actual URLs or paths relevant to your application. This structure can be expanded and customized further based on your specific requirements and design preferences.

view and url also

Sure, to complement the product_home.html template, you'll need to create a corresponding view function and set up the URL routing in Django. Here's how you can do it:

views.py

Assuming you have an app named product:

python
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.contrib.auth.decorators import login_required

@login_required
def product_home(request):
    return render(request, 'product/product_home.html')

urls.py

In your app's urls.py file (or the project's main urls.py if you're including app-specific URLs):

python
from django.urls import path
from . import views

app_name = 'product'

urlpatterns = [
    path('product_home/', views.product_home, name='product_home'),
    # Define other URLs related to product management as needed
]

Explanation:

  • views.py:
    • The product_home view function uses the render method to render the product/product_home.html template. This function is decorated with @login_required to ensure only authenticated users can access it.
  • urls.py:
    • urlpatterns defines a path (product_home/) that maps to the product_home view function from views.py.
    • Adjust the URL path (product_home/) according to your project's URL structure.

Integration:

  1. Authentication: Ensure that the @login_required decorator is imported (from django.contrib.auth.decorators import login_required) and applied to views that require authentication.

  2. Template Naming: Ensure your template (product_home.html) is placed in the correct directory (product/templates/product/product_home.html assuming your app is named product).

  3. URL Configuration: Include the app's URLs in the project's main urls.py using include() if needed, like:

    python
    from django.urls import include, path

urlpatterns = [
    path('product/', include('product.urls')),
    # Other paths in your project
]

With these steps, accessing /product/product_home/ in your Django application should render the product_home.html template, displaying the product management interface as designed in your HTML and CSS. Adjust the URLs and view names according to your specific project structure and requirements.

To create a 2x4 matrix layout for the navigation links in your product_home.html, where links are arranged in 2 rows and 4 columns, you can modify the HTML structure and CSS accordingly. Here's how you can achieve it:

Updated product_home.html

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Product Management</title>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: space-between;
            height: 100vh;
            background-color: #f0f0f0;
        }

        h1 {
            margin-top: 20px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .nav-container {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr); /* 4 columns in a row */
            gap: 20px; /* Gap between grid items */
            justify-content: center;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .nav-container a {
            display: inline-block;
            padding: 15px 20px;
            font-size: 16px;
            color: white;
            text-decoration: none;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: background-color 0.3s, color 0.3s;
            text-align: center;
            border: 2px solid #4CAF50;
            background-color: #4CAF50;
            border-radius: 5px;
        }

        .nav-container a:hover {
            background-color: #45a049;
            border-color: #45a049;
        }

        .back-container {
            margin-bottom: 20px; /* Ensure some spacing from the bottom */
        }

        @media (max-width: 800px) {
            .nav-container {
                grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr); /* 2 columns in a row for smaller screens */
            }

            .nav-container a, .back-container a {
                padding: 12px 16px;
                font-size: 14px;
            }
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Welcome to Product Management</h1>
    <div class="nav-container">
        <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">Add Item</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:item_list' %}">Item List</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:add_supplier' %}">Add Supplier</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:supplier_list' %}">Supplier List</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:prd_add' %}">Add Products</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:prd_list' %}">Products List</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_add' %}">Add Stock</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_list' %}">Stocks List</a>
    </div>
    <div class="back-container">
        <a href="{% url 'employee:home' %}">Back</a>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

Explanation:

  • Grid Layout:
    • .nav-container uses CSS Grid layout (display: grid;) to arrange items in a 2x4 matrix (grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr);).
    • gap: 20px; adds space between grid items.
  • Media Queries:
    • @media (max-width: 800px): Adjusts the grid to a 2-column layout (grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr);) for screens narrower than 800px.
    • .nav-container a, .back-container a adjusts padding and font size for smaller screens to maintain usability.

This structure ensures that your product management links are neatly organized into a 2x4 grid on larger screens, providing a responsive layout that adjusts gracefully on smaller devices. Adjust the URLs ({% url ... %}) to match your Django project's URL configuration.

To integrate an external CSS file named item_form.css into your Django template (item_form.html), you need to follow these steps:

1. Create item_form.css

Create a CSS file named item_form.css in your static files directory (static/css/ assuming css is a subdirectory of static).

css
/* item_form.css */

/* Body styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    padding: 20px;
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: center;
}

h1 {
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

form {
    width: 50%;
    margin-top: 20px;
    background-color: #fff;
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

form button {
    background-color: #4CAF50;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    text-align: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    display: inline-block;
    font-size: 16px;
    margin-top: 10px;
    cursor: pointer;
    border-radius: 5px;
    transition: background-color 0.3s;
}

form button:hover {
    background-color: #45a049;
}

a {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #007bff; /* Bootstrap primary color */
}

a:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
    color: #0056b3; /* Darker shade of primary color */
}

2. Link item_form.css in your Django template (item_form.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>{{ title }}</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/item_form.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <h1>{{ title }}</h1>
    <form method="post">
        {% csrf_token %}
        {{ form.as_p }}
        <button type="submit">{{ title }}</button>
    </form>
    <a href="{% url 'product:item_list' %}">Back to item list</a>
</body>
</html>

Explanation:

  • CSS File (item_form.css):
    • Defines styles for body, h1, form, button, and a elements.
    • Uses border-radius, box-shadow, and transitions (transition: background-color 0.3s;) for visual effects.
    • Styles button and a for hover effects (:hover).
  • HTML Template (item_form.html):
    • Includes {% load static %} at the beginning to load static files.
    • Links item_form.css using {% static 'css/item_form.css' %}.
    • Uses Django template variables ({{ title }}, {{ form.as_p }}, {% csrf_token %}) to render dynamic content.
    • Provides a form with a submit button and a link (<a>) to navigate back to the item list ({% url 'product:item_list' %}).

By following these steps, your Django template (item_form.html) will be styled using the item_form.css stylesheet, ensuring consistent and visually appealing presentation of your form and content. Adjust paths and styles in item_form.css as needed to match your specific design requirements.

To create an external CSS file named item_list.css and integrate it into your Django template (item_list.html), follow these steps:

1. Create item_list.css

Create a CSS file named item_list.css in your static files directory (static/css/ assuming css is a subdirectory of static).

css
/* item_list.css */

/* Body styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    padding: 20px;
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;

}

    margin-top: 20px;
    text-align: center;

    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;

}

    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #007bff; /* Bootstrap primary color */
}

2. Link item_list.css in your Django template (item_list.html)

html

</head>

    <h1>Item List</h1>
    <ul>
        {% for item in items %}
        <li>
            {{ item.Item_Name }} 
            <a href="{% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}">Edit</a>
        </li>
        {% endfor %}
    </ul>
    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}" class="add-item-link">Add a new item</a>
</body>
</html>

Explanation:

  • CSS File (item_list.css):

    • Defines styles for body, h1, ul, li, a elements.
    • Uses background-color, padding, margin, border-radius, box-shadow for layout and visual effects.
    • Styles li a for hover effects (:hover).
    • Defines a.add-item-link for styling the "Add a new item" link.

  • HTML Template (item_list.html):

    • Includes {% load static %} at the beginning to load static files.
    • Links item_list.css using {% static 'css/item_list.css' %}.
    • Uses Django template variables ({{ item.Item_Name }}, {% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}, {% url 'product:add_item' %}) to render dynamic content.
    • Provides a list (<ul>) of items (<li>) with edit links (<a>) and a link (<a>) to add a new item.

By following these steps, your Django template (item_list.html) will be styled using the item_list.css stylesheet, ensuring consistent and visually appealing presentation of your item list and related actions. Adjust paths and styles in item_list.css as needed to match your specific design requirements.

give it as a table

To display the list of items in a table format and style it using an external CSS file (item_list.css), follow these steps:

1. Create item_list.css

Create a CSS file named item_list.css in your static files directory (static/css/ assuming css is a subdirectory of static).

css
/* item_list.css */

/* Body styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    padding: 20px;
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: center;
}

h1 {
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-align: center;
}

/* Table styles */
table {
    width: 80%;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    margin-top: 20px;
    background-color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

table th, table td {
    padding: 10px;
    text-align: left;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd;
}

table th {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
}

table tr:hover {
    background-color: #f5f5f5;
}

/* Link styles */
a {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #007bff; /* Bootstrap primary color */
}

a:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
    color: #0056b3; /* Darker shade of primary color */
}

2. Update item_list.html to Use a Table Layout

Update your HTML template (item_list.html) to use a table layout to display the items.

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Item List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/item_list.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Item List</h1>
    <table>
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Item Name</th>
                <th>Edit</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            {% for item in items %}
            <tr>
                <td>{{ item.Item_Name }}</td>
                <td><a href="{% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}">Edit</a></td>
            </tr>
            {% endfor %}
        </tbody>
    </table>
    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">Add a new item</a>
</body>
</html>

Explanation:

  • CSS File (item_list.css):

    • Defines styles for body, h1, table, th, td, tr, and a elements.
    • Uses border-collapse, background-color, border-radius, box-shadow for the table layout and visual effects.
    • Styles table th for header background color and table tr:hover for hover effect on table rows.
    • Defines a and a:hover for styling links.

  • HTML Template (item_list.html):

    • Includes {% load static %} at the beginning to load static files.
    • Links item_list.css using {% static 'css/item_list.css' %}.
    • Uses a <table> element with <thead> for headers and <tbody> for rows to display the list of items ({{ item.Item_Name }}).
    • Provides an "Edit" link (<a>) for each item ({% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}) in the table rows (<tr>).
    • Includes a link (<a>) to add a new item ({% url 'product:add_item' %}) below the table.

By following these steps, your Django template (item_list.html) will display the list of items in a table format styled using the item_list.css stylesheet. Adjust paths and styles in item_list.css as needed to match your specific design requirements.

}

    margin-top: 20px;

}

/* Table styles */
table {
    width: 80%;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    margin-top: 20px;
    background-color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

table th, table td {
    padding: 10px;
    text-align: left;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd;
}

table th {
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
}

table tr:hover {
    background-color: #f5f5f5;
}

/* Link styles */
a {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    margin-top: 20px;
    text-decoration: none;
    color: #007bff; /* Bootstrap primary color */
}

a:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
    color: #0056b3; /* Darker shade of primary color */
}

/* Specific row styles */
tr#item-row-odd {
    background-color: #fff;
}

tr#item-row-even {
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
}

2. Update item_list.html with IDs

Modify your HTML template (item_list.html) to include IDs (item-row-odd and item-row-even) for each row in the table. You can use Django's template logic to alternate between IDs for even and odd rows.

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Item List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/item_list.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Item List</h1>
    <table>
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Item Name</th>
                <th>Edit</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            {% for item in items %}
            <tr id="item-row-{{ forloop.counter0|divisibleby:2|yesno:'even,odd' }}">
                <td>{{ item.Item_Name }}</td>
                <td><a href="{% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}">Edit</a></td>
            </tr>
            {% endfor %}
        </tbody>
    </table>
    <a href="{% url 'product:add_item' %}">Add a new item</a>
</body>
</html>

Explanation:

  • CSS File (item_list.css):

    • Added styles for rows with specific IDs (tr#item-row-odd and tr#item-row-even).
    • Uses background-color to distinguish odd and even rows for better readability.

  • HTML Template (item_list.html):

    • Uses {% for item in items %} to iterate over items.
    • Uses {{ forloop.counter0|divisibleby:2|yesno:'even,odd' }} to dynamically assign IDs (item-row-even or item-row-odd) to each <tr> based on its position in the loop.
    • Links (<a>) to edit each item ({% url 'product:edit_item' item.pk %}) and to add a new item ({% url 'product:add_item' %}) are provided outside the <table>.

By following these steps, your Django template (item_list.html) will display the list of items in a table format with alternating row styles based on their IDs, styled using the item_list.css stylesheet. Adjust paths and styles in item_list.css as needed to match your specific design requirements.

Here is the updated HTML to include the external CSS file, followed by the responsive external CSS file named product_list.css.

Updated HTML (product_list.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Product List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'css/product_list.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Product List</h1>

    <!-- Link to add a new product -->
    <a href="{% url 'product:prd_add' %}">Add Product</a>

    <!-- Form for searching products -->
    <form method="get" action="{% url 'product:prd_list' %}">
        <input type="text" name="q" placeholder="Search products" value="{{ request.GET.q }}">
        <button type="submit">Search</button>
    </form>
    <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>

    <!-- Container for displaying product list -->
    <div id="productList">
        <!-- Check if there are products to display -->
        {% if products %}
            <!-- Table for displaying product details -->
            <table>
                <thead>
                    <!-- Table header with column names -->
                    <tr>
                        <th>Item Name</th>
                        <th>Supplier Name</th>
                        <th>Quantity</th>
                        <th>Price per Piece</th>
                        <th>Total Price</th>
                        <th>Purchase Date</th>
                        <th>Invoice Number</th>
                        <th>Actions</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                    <!-- Iterate over each product -->
                    {% for product in products %}
                        <!-- Table row for each product -->
                        <tr>
                            <!-- Display product details in each column -->
                            <td>{{ product.Item.Item_Name }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.Supplier.Supplier_Name }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.Quantity }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.price_per_piece|floatformat:2 }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.Price }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.Purchase_Date }}</td>
                            <td>{{ product.Invoice_Number }}</td>
                            <!-- Actions column for editing and deleting products -->
                            <td>
                                <!-- Edit button to update product details -->
                                <button onclick="location.href='{% url 'product:prd_edit' product.pk %}'">Edit</button>
                                
                                <!-- Form for deleting the product -->
                                <form method="post" action="{% url 'product:prd_delete' product.pk %}" style="display: inline;">
                                    {% csrf_token %}
                                    <!-- Button to delete the product -->
                                    <button type="button" onclick="confirmDelete(this)">Delete</button>
                                </form>
                            </td>
                        </tr>
                    {% endfor %}
                </tbody>
            </table>
        <!-- If no products are found, display a message -->
        {% else %}
            <p>No products found.</p>
        {% endif %}
    </div>
    
    <!-- JavaScript function to confirm product deletion -->
    <script>
        function confirmDelete(button) {
            // Ask for confirmation before deleting
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to delete this product?")) {
                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;
                // Get the CSRF token value from the form
                const csrfToken = form.querySelector('[name=csrfmiddlewaretoken]').value;

                // Send a DELETE request to delete the product
                fetch(form.action, {
                    method: 'DELETE',
                    headers: {
                        'X-CSRFToken': csrfToken
                    }
                }).then(response => {
                    // Check if deletion is successful
                    if (response.ok) {
                        alert("Product deleted successfully");
                        // Remove the row from the table
                        const row = button.closest('tr');
                        row.remove();
                    } else if (response.status === 404) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 404 Not Found
                        alert("Product not found. Please refresh the page.");
                    } else if (response.status === 403) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 403 Forbidden
                        alert("You are not authorized to delete this product.");
                    } else {
                        // Display a generic error message for other errors
                        alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                    }
                }).catch(error => {
                    console.error('Error deleting product:', error);
                    alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                });
            }
        }
    </script>

</body>
</html>

        width: 100%;
    }

    form input[type="text"], form button, a {
        width: 100%;
        box-sizing: border-box;
    }

This CSS ensures that the product list table and other elements will be responsive, centering the content in the table cells, and adjusting the layout on smaller screens. The width of the table is reduced to 80% to ensure it doesn't occupy the full width of the page, making it look more centered and organized.

            // Ask for confirmation before deleting

                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;

all other thing like above just align the table center

Sure, to align the table vertically in the center of the page, we can use flexbox properties on the body and a container around the table. Here are the updated HTML and CSS files:

Updated HTML (product_list.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Product List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'css/product_list.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Product List</h1>

        <!-- Link to add a new product -->
        <a href="{% url 'product:prd_add' %}">Add Product</a>

        <!-- Form for searching products -->
        <form method="get" action="{% url 'product:prd_list' %}">
            <input type="text" name="q" placeholder="Search products" value="{{ request.GET.q }}">
            <button type="submit">Search</button>
        </form>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>

        <!-- Container for displaying product list -->
        <div id="productList">
            <!-- Check if there are products to display -->
            {% if products %}
                <!-- Table for displaying product details -->
                <table>
                    <thead>
                        <!-- Table header with column names -->
                        <tr>
                            <th>Item Name</th>
                            <th>Supplier Name</th>
                            <th>Quantity</th>
                            <th>Price per Piece</th>
                            <th>Total Price</th>
                            <th>Purchase Date</th>
                            <th>Invoice Number</th>
                            <th>Actions</th>
                        </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                        <!-- Iterate over each product -->
                        {% for product in products %}
                            <!-- Table row for each product -->
                            <tr>
                                <!-- Display product details in each column -->
                                <td>{{ product.Item.Item_Name }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Supplier.Supplier_Name }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Quantity }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.price_per_piece|floatformat:2 }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Price }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Purchase_Date }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Invoice_Number }}</td>
                                <!-- Actions column for editing and deleting products -->
                                <td>
                                    <!-- Edit button to update product details -->
                                    <button onclick="location.href='{% url 'product:prd_edit' product.pk %}'">Edit</button>
                                    
                                    <!-- Form for deleting the product -->
                                    <form method="post" action="{% url 'product:prd_delete' product.pk %}" style="display: inline;">
                                        {% csrf_token %}
                                        <!-- Button to delete the product -->
                                        <button type="button" onclick="confirmDelete(this)">Delete</button>
                                    </form>
                                </td>
                            </tr>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tbody>
                </table>
            <!-- If no products are found, display a message -->
            {% else %}
                <p>No products found.</p>
            {% endif %}
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JavaScript function to confirm product deletion -->
    <script>
        function confirmDelete(button) {
            // Ask for confirmation before deleting
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to delete this product?")) {
                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;
                // Get the CSRF token value from the form
                const csrfToken = form.querySelector('[name=csrfmiddlewaretoken]').value;

                // Send a DELETE request to delete the product
                fetch(form.action, {
                    method: 'DELETE',
                    headers: {
                        'X-CSRFToken': csrfToken
                    }
                }).then(response => {
                    // Check if deletion is successful
                    if (response.ok) {
                        alert("Product deleted successfully");
                        // Remove the row from the table
                        const row = button.closest('tr');
                        row.remove();
                    } else if (response.status === 404) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 404 Not Found
                        alert("Product not found. Please refresh the page.");
                    } else if (response.status === 403) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 403 Forbidden
                        alert("You are not authorized to delete this product.");
                    } else {
                        // Display a generic error message for other errors
                        alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                    }
                }).catch(error => {
                    console.error('Error deleting product:', error);
                    alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                });
            }
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>

HTML with Updated Structure

Here's how you can structure your HTML to ensure everything is aligned as per your requirements:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Product List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/product_list.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="top-nav">
        <a href="{% url 'product:prd_add' %}">Add Product</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>
    </div>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Product List</h1>

        <!-- Form for searching products -->
        <form method="get" action="{% url 'product:prd_list' %}">
            <input type="text" name="q" placeholder="Search products" value="{{ request.GET.q }}">
            <button type="submit">Search</button>
        </form>

        <!-- Container for displaying product list -->
        <div id="productList">
            <!-- Check if there are products to display -->
            {% if products %}
                <!-- Table for displaying product details -->
                <table>
                    <thead>
                        <!-- Table header with column names -->
                        <tr>
                            <th>Item Name</th>
                            <th>Supplier Name</th>
                            <th>Quantity</th>
                            <th>Price per Piece</th>
                            <th>Total Price</th>
                            <th>Purchase Date</th>
                            <th>Invoice Number</th>
                            <th>Actions</th>
                        </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                        <!-- Iterate over each product -->
                        {% for product in products %}
                            <!-- Table row for each product -->
                            <tr>
                                <!-- Display product details in each column -->
                                <td>{{ product.Item.Item_Name }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Supplier.Supplier_Name }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Quantity }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.price_per_piece|floatformat:2 }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Price }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Purchase_Date }}</td>
                                <td>{{ product.Invoice_Number }}</td>
                                <!-- Actions column for editing and deleting products -->
                                <td>
                                    <!-- Edit button to update product details -->
                                    <button onclick="location.href='{% url 'product:prd_edit' product.pk %}'">Edit</button>
                                    
                                    <!-- Form for deleting the product -->
                                    <form method="post" action="{% url 'product:prd_delete' product.pk %}" style="display: inline;">
                                        {% csrf_token %}
                                        <!-- Button to delete the product -->
                                        <button type="button" onclick="confirmDelete(this)">Delete</button>
                                    </form>
                                </td>
                            </tr>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tbody>
                </table>
            <!-- If no products are found, display a message -->
            {% else %}
                <p>No products found.</p>
            {% endif %}
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JavaScript function to confirm product deletion -->
    <script>
        function confirmDelete(button) {
            // Ask for confirmation before deleting
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to delete this product?")) {
                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;
                // Get the CSRF token value from the form
                const csrfToken = form.querySelector('[name=csrfmiddlewaretoken]').value;

                // Send a DELETE request to delete the product
                fetch(form.action, {
                    method: 'DELETE',
                    headers: {
                        'X-CSRFToken': csrfToken
                    }
                }).then(response => {
                    // Check if deletion is successful
                    if (response.ok) {
                        alert("Product deleted successfully");
                        // Remove the row from the table
                        const row = button.closest('tr');
                        row.remove();
                    } else if (response.status === 404) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 404 Not Found
                        alert("Product not found. Please refresh the page.");
                    } else if (response.status === 403) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 403 Forbidden
                        alert("You are not authorized to delete this product.");
                    } else {
                        // Display a generic error message for other errors
                        alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                    }
                }).catch(error => {
                    console.error('Error deleting product:', error);
                    alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the product.");
                });
            }
        }
    </script>

</body>
</html>

This ensures the table is vertically centered and the navigation links "Add Product" and "View Remaining Stock" are positioned at the top-right side of the page.

Updated stock_in.html with Navigation Bar

Include the updated navigation CSS and HTML structure in your Django template:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Stock In List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/stock_nav.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="top-nav">
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_add' %}">Add Stock Entry</a>
    </div>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Stock In List</h1>

        <!-- Form for searching stock entries -->
        <form method="get" action="{% url 'product:stock_in_list' %}">
            <input type="text" name="q" placeholder="Search stock entries" value="{{ request.GET.q }}">
            <button type="submit">Search</button>
        </form>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>

        <!-- Container for displaying stock entries -->
        <div id="stockList">
            <!-- Check if there are stock entries to display -->
            {% if stock_entries %}
                <!-- Table for displaying stock entry details -->
                <table border="1">
                    <thead>
                        <!-- Table header with column names -->
                        <tr>
                            <th>Employee</th>
                            <th>Item</th>
                            <th>Quantity</th>
                            <th>Issue Date</th>
                            <th>Actions</th>
                        </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                        <!-- Iterate over each stock entry -->
                        {% for stock in stock_entries %}
                            <!-- Table row for each stock entry -->
                            <tr>
                                <!-- Display stock entry details in each column -->
                                <td>{{ stock.employee }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.item }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.Quantity }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.issue_date }}</td>
                                <!-- Actions column for editing and deleting stock entries -->
                                <td>
                                    <!-- Edit button to update stock entry details -->
                                    <button onclick="location.href='{% url 'product:stock_in_edit' stock.pk %}'">Edit</button>
                                    
                                    <!-- Form for deleting the stock entry -->
                                    <form method="post" action="{% url 'product:stock_in_delete' stock.pk %}" style="display: inline;">
                                        {% csrf_token %}
                                        <!-- Button to delete the stock entry -->
                                        <button type="button" onclick="confirmDelete(this)">Delete</button>
                                    </form>
                                </td>
                            </tr>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tbody>
                </table>
            <!-- If no stock entries are found, display a message -->
            {% else %}
                <p>No stock entries found.</p>
            {% endif %}
        </div>
    </div>
    
    <!-- JavaScript function to confirm stock entry deletion -->
    <script>
        function confirmDelete(button) {
            // Ask for confirmation before deleting
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to delete this stock entry?")) {
                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;
                // Get the CSRF token value from the form
                const csrfToken = form.querySelector('[name=csrfmiddlewaretoken]').value;

                // Send a DELETE request to delete the stock entry
                fetch(form.action, {
                    method: 'DELETE',
                    headers: {
                        'X-CSRFToken': csrfToken
                    }
                }).then(response => {
                    // Check if deletion is successful
                    if (response.ok) {
                        alert("Stock entry deleted successfully");
                        // Remove the row from the table
                        const row = button.closest('tr');
                        row.remove();
                    } else if (response.status === 404) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 404 Not Found
                        alert("Stock entry not found. Please refresh the page.");
                    } else if (response.status === 403) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 403 Forbidden
                        alert("You are not authorized to delete this stock entry.");
                    } else {
                        // Display a generic error message for other errors
                        alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the stock entry.");
                    }
                }).catch(error => {
                    console.error('Error deleting stock entry:', error);
                    alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the stock entry.");
                });
            }
        }
    </script>
    
</body>
</html>

Explanation

  1. Navigation Bar: The .top-nav class is styled to be fixed at the top right corner (top: 0; right: 0;). It has a dark background color (#333), white text, and padding (10px 20px) for spacing around the link.

  2. Navigation Links: The link (a tag) within .top-nav is styled with default white text color, which changes to black on hover (:hover).

  3. HTML Structure: The HTML structure includes the navigation bar (top-nav) and a container (container) for the form and content. The navigation bar is positioned fixed at the top of the page using CSS.

Ensure that you have the correct paths in the href attribute of the link tag (href="{% static 'css/stock_nav.css' %}") to match the actual location of your CSS file within your Django project's static files directory. This setup will create a navigation bar at the top right corner of your stock_in.html template, providing easy access to the "Add Stock Entry" page.

Updated stock_in.html Template

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Stock In List</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/stock_in.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="top-nav">
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_add' %}">Add Stock Entry</a>
    </div>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Stock In List</h1>

        <!-- Form for searching stock entries -->
        <form method="get" action="{% url 'product:stock_in_list' %}">
            <input type="text" name="q" placeholder="Search stock entries" value="{{ request.GET.q }}">
            <button type="submit">Search</button>
        </form>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>

        <!-- Container for displaying stock entries -->
        <div id="stockList">
            <!-- Check if there are stock entries to display -->
            {% if stock_entries %}
                <!-- Table for displaying stock entry details -->
                <table>
                    <thead>
                        <!-- Table header with column names -->
                        <tr>
                            <th>Employee</th>
                            <th>Item</th>
                            <th>Quantity</th>
                            <th>Issue Date</th>
                            <th>Actions</th>
                        </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                        <!-- Iterate over each stock entry -->
                        {% for stock in stock_entries %}
                            <!-- Table row for each stock entry -->
                            <tr>
                                <!-- Display stock entry details in each column -->
                                <td>{{ stock.employee }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.item }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.Quantity }}</td>
                                <td>{{ stock.issue_date }}</td>
                                <!-- Actions column for editing and deleting stock entries -->
                                <td>
                                    <!-- Edit button to update stock entry details -->
                                    <button onclick="location.href='{% url 'product:stock_in_edit' stock.pk %}'">Edit</button>
                                    
                                    <!-- Form for deleting the stock entry -->
                                    <form method="post" action="{% url 'product:stock_in_delete' stock.pk %}" style="display: inline;">
                                        {% csrf_token %}
                                        <!-- Button to delete the stock entry -->
                                        <button type="button" onclick="confirmDelete(this)">Delete</button>
                                    </form>
                                </td>
                            </tr>
                        {% endfor %}
                    </tbody>
                </table>
            <!-- If no stock entries are found, display a message -->
            {% else %}
                <p>No stock entries found.</p>
            {% endif %}
        </div>
    </div>
    
    <!-- JavaScript function to confirm stock entry deletion -->
    <script>
        function confirmDelete(button) {
            // Ask for confirmation before deleting
            if (confirm("Are you sure you want to delete this stock entry?")) {
                // Get the form containing the delete button
                const form = button.parentElement;
                // Get the CSRF token value from the form
                const csrfToken = form.querySelector('[name=csrfmiddlewaretoken]').value;

                // Send a DELETE request to delete the stock entry
                fetch(form.action, {
                    method: 'DELETE',
                    headers: {
                        'X-CSRFToken': csrfToken
                    }
                }).then(response => {
                    // Check if deletion is successful
                    if (response.ok) {
                        alert("Stock entry deleted successfully");
                        // Remove the row from the table
                        const row = button.closest('tr');
                        row.remove();
                    } else if (response.status === 404) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 404 Not Found
                        alert("Stock entry not found. Please refresh the page.");
                    } else if (response.status === 403) {
                        // Display a specific error message for 403 Forbidden
                        alert("You are not authorized to delete this stock entry.");
                    } else {
                        // Display a generic error message for other errors
                        alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the stock entry.");
                    }
                }).catch(error => {
                    console.error('Error deleting stock entry:', error);
                    alert("An error occurred while trying to delete the stock entry.");
                });
            }
        }
    </script>
    
</body>
</html>

Explanation

  • Reset Styles: The * selector resets margin and padding for all elements to ensure consistent spacing.
  • Body and Container: The body has padding-top to accommodate the fixed navigation bar. The .container class centers the content horizontally with a max-width of 1200px and adds padding.
  • Navigation Bar: .top-nav is styled to be fixed at the top right corner with a dark background. Links (a tags) are centered horizontally with padding and hover effects.
  • Form and Search: Form elements are styled for consistency, with inputs adjusting width responsively.
  • Table: The table is styled with borders and padding for clarity. thead and tbody separate header and content rows.
  • Responsive Design: Media query (@media (max-width: 768px)) adjusts input width and centers navigation links for smaller screens, ensuring usability across devices.

This setup ensures your stock_in.html page and navigation are responsive and display well across various devices and screen sizes. Adjust the CSS as needed based on your specific styling preferences and project requirements.

To create the "Create Stock Entry" form within a table layout, here's how you can structure the HTML and apply the CSS for styling:

HTML Template (stock_in.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Create Stock Entry</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/stock_add.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="top-nav">
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_list' %}">Stock List</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>
    </div>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Create Stock Entry</h1>
        
        <!-- Form within a table -->
        <form method="post">
            {% csrf_token %}
            <table class="stock-form">
                <tbody>
                    <!-- Item selection -->
                    <tr>
                        <th><label for="id_item">Item:</label></th>
                        <td>{{ form.item }}</td>
                    </tr>
                    <!-- Quantity input -->
                    <tr>
                        <th><label for="id_quantity">Quantity:</label></th>
                        <td>{{ form.Quantity }}</td>
                    </tr>
                    <!-- Employee selection -->
                    <tr>
                        <th><label for="id_employee">Employee:</label></th>
                        <td>{{ form.employee }}</td>
                    </tr>
                    <!-- Issue Date input -->
                    <tr>
                        <th><label for="id_issue_date">Issue Date:</label></th>
                        <td>{{ form.issue_date }}</td>
                    </tr>
                    <!-- Submit button -->
                    <tr>
                        <td colspan="2">
                            <button type="submit">Save</button>
                        </td>
                    </tr>
                </tbody>
            </table>
        </form>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

CSS for Table Layout (stock_add.css)

css
/* Reset default margin and padding */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Body and container styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

.container {
    max-width: 800px;
    margin: 20px auto;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #fff;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/* Top Navigation Bar styles */
.top-nav {
    width: 100%;
    background-color: #333;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    color: white;
}

.top-nav a {
    color: white;
    text-decoration: none;
    padding: 10px 20px;
}

.top-nav a:hover {
    background-color: #555;
}

/* Form within table styles */
.stock-form {
    width: 100%;
    margin-top: 20px;
    border-collapse: collapse;
}

.stock-form th, .stock-form td {
    padding: 10px;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd;
    text-align: left;
}

.stock-form th {
    width: 30%;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.stock-form td {
    width: 70%;
}

.stock-form input[type="text"], 
.stock-form select {
    width: calc(100% - 20px);
    padding: 8px;
    font-size: 14px;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
    border-radius: 3px;
}

.stock-form button {
    padding: 10px 20px;
    background-color: #4CAF50;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    font-size: 16px;
}

.stock-form button:hover {
    background-color: #45a049;
}

Explanation

  • HTML Structure: The form is structured inside a <table> for a tabular layout of form elements (item, Quantity, employee, issue_date, and submit button).
  • CSS Styling:
    • Reset Styles: Ensures consistent default styles.
    • Body and Container: Sets font and background styles for the body and centers the container horizontally with a maximum width.
    • Top Navigation Bar: Styles the navigation bar (top-nav) with a dark background, spaced links, and hover effects.
    • Form within Table: Defines styles for the form (stock-form) inside a <table>, including table cell (<th> and <td>) styles, input fields (input[type="text"], select), and button styles (button).

This setup provides a responsive and neatly organized form layout using HTML tables, suitable for entering stock entries with structured input fields and a clear submit button. Adjust the CSS and HTML as needed based on your specific project requirements and design preferences.

    • Form within Table: Defines styles for the form (stock-form) inside a <table>, including table cell (<td>) styles, input fields (input[type="text"], select), label styles (label), and button styles (button).

This setup provides a responsive and neatly organized form layout using HTML tables, suitable for entering stock entries with structured input fields and a clear submit button. Adjust the CSS and HTML as needed based on your specific project requirements and design preferences.

To achieve a responsive layout with a navigation bar and a form styled similarly to your request, here's how you can structure the HTML and CSS:

HTML Template (template.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>{{ title }}</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="{% static 'css/style.css' %}">
</head>
<body>
    <div class="top-nav">
        <a href="{% url 'product:prd_add' %}">Add Product</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_list' %}">Stock List</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:remaining_stock' %}">View Remaining Stock</a>
        <a href="{% url 'product:stock_in_add' %}">Add Stock Entry</a>
    </div>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>{{ title }}</h1>
        <form method="post">
            {% csrf_token %}
            {{ form.as_p }}
            <button type="submit">Submit</button>
        </form>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

CSS Styles (style.css)

css
/* Reset default margin and padding */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Body and container styles */
body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #f0f0f0;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}

.container {
    max-width: 800px;
    margin: 20px auto;
    padding: 20px;
    background-color: #fff;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/* Top Navigation Bar styles */
.top-nav {
    background-color: #333;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: flex-end;
    padding: 10px;
}

.top-nav a {
    color: white;
    text-decoration: none;
    padding: 10px 20px;
}

.top-nav a:hover {
    background-color: #555;
}

/* Form styles */
form {
    margin-top: 20px;
}

form label {
    display: block;
    margin-bottom: 8px;
    font-weight: bold;
}

form input[type="text"],
form select {
    width: calc(100% - 20px);
    padding: 8px;
    font-size: 14px;
    border: 1px solid #ddd;
    border-radius: 3px;
}

form button {
    margin-top: 10px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    background-color: #4CAF50;
    color: white;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 5px;
    cursor: pointer;
    font-size: 16px;
}

form button:hover {
    background-color: #45a049;
}

Explanation:

  • HTML Structure:
    • The <div class="top-nav"> contains navigation links (<a>) for adding a product, viewing stock lists, and managing stock entries.
    • The form (<form>) is placed within a <div class="container"> for content organization.
  • CSS Styling:
    • Reset Styles: Ensures consistent default styles across different browsers (* selector).
    • Body and Container: Sets font and background styles for the body and centers the container horizontally with a maximum width.
    • Top Navigation Bar: Styles the navigation bar (top-nav) with a dark background, right-aligned links, and hover effects.
    • Form Styling:
      • Adjusts margins and padding for form elements (form).
      • Styles labels (form label) for form fields.
      • Defines input fields (form input[type="text"], form select) and submit button (form button) with appropriate sizes, colors, and hover effects.

Usage:

  • Ensure to replace {{ title }} and {{ form.as_p }} with your actual Django template context variables.
  • Replace href values in <a> tags with actual Django URLs from your project ({% url 'app_name:view_name' %}).
  • Adjust the CSS (style.css) as needed to match your project's design requirements.

This setup provides a clean and responsive layout with a navigation bar and a styled form, suitable for managing product entries or stock entries in your Django application. Adjust the CSS and HTML structure further based on specific design needs or additional functionality requirements.
